ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became familiar with the field of 17th and 18th century literature, which is something I NEVER thought I would say  and learned to really love it!! I also saw my writing improve immensely thanks to Prof. Campbell's comprehensive feedback. Take this class!!!!
Better understanding of transatlantic histories from a wide variety of perspectives and time periods!

-Read and analyze complex texts 
-Build an argument in an essay
This was the first English course Ive taken at Yale, so I was learning how to write an English paper and practice close reading and literature analysis.
Gained a deeper understanding of the issues that arise when thinking about race and gender in relation to the slave trade.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: So many strengths!! The syllabus is thoughtfully crafted and the class really makes older literature come alive. Prof Campbell is such an expert in the field and also cares deeply about her students, and that really shines through, making the class environment so lovely.
Strengths: Professor Campbell! Readings! Class content! Weaknesses: None!

I think the strength of the course is its professor. Prof. Campbell is amazing and engaging, completely dedicated to the material. What I found a bit difficult in the course was its organization. It felt like we weren't necessarily moving chronologically or thematically; if the order of the texts had been rearranged, I may have gotten more out of them.

Strengths
-Teacher 
-Works (combination of contemporary and old works)
-Class size

Professor Campbell is good at pointing the seminar towards parts of the text and engaging us with the course material. She also gave very thorough and useful comments on our papers. In terms of weakness, there were just moments in the class where there would be silence because the discussion dried out.

- syllabus is very well crafted
- helpful office hours before essays
- INCREDIBLE feedback
Excellent course. The thing I most appreciated this semester was Prof. Campbell's flexibility, understanding that this was first and foremost a very difficult semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 1000000%!! Take this course. I am not an English major, and have always been so wary of older literature, but the access points of race and gender made this class so interesting and important. I loved it. Whether you're an English major or non major, take it !!
Yes! Especially with Professor Campbell! She creates an extremely inclusive classroom environment and fosters intriguing conversations.
This is an excellent class. The reading list is fantastic and the course is well organized. Discussions are always engaging and I definitely recommend it!

If you're interested in the subject material, then I'd say it's a good course. It's also a great course for non-English majors to dip their toe into an English class, as there's not a huge amount of reading.
Definitely! The professor is fantastic and the size/organization facilitates student learning.
Yes! Professor Campbell is such a great professor and is patient and willing to help students if its their first English class. The course material is also very interesting.

YES! Professor Campbell has given me better feedback than any of my many other English classes, by far. She cares so much and edits your essays with deeply insightful feedback. I am deeply grateful for the amount of effort she gave in helping me improve as a scholar and writer. The syllabus is also incredibly well crafted. The only downside is at times the seminar discussions meandered and could have been more pointed.
Absolutely! Professor Campbell is amazing and the course is interesting and well-designed.
